channel.title: Whonix setup wizard
channel.description: in qubes sys-whonix when try to connect tor using setup wizard, there's missing bridge options such as snowflak (two options), obfs3, etc... please kindly add all the features

item.title: Whonix setup wizard
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Reporting_Bugs#Community_Feedback

Whonix snowflake documentation:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Bridges#Snowflake

snowflake development discussion:

Replacing meek: Snowflake Development
Unfortunately meek will soon be dead as domain fronting will be disabled everywhere. Snowflake is the obvious candidate successor because it uses distributed P2P connections and can workaround the domain fronting problem by communicating via DNS-over-HTTPS. @iry Thanks for your efforts to give us meek. Will it be feasible to integrate snowflake any time soon? What tasks are needed so I can make a roadmap? https://blog.torproject.org/domain-fronting-critical-open-web [im…
Use Snowflake in Whonix to Bypass Tor censorship Support
Snowflake is a new pluggable transport available in Tor Browser to defeat internet censorship. In this post, we introduce how to use it in Whonix. We use Qubes-Whonix as an example, and assume we have two template VMs: whonix-ws-16 and whonix-gw-16; and one whonix-gateway VM sys-whonix. The general idea is the same for other platforms that run Whonix. Get snowflake-client binary Since Whonix-gateway does not ship a Tor Browser Bundle by default, we get snowflake-client binary by transferring …

Read full topic
